revision.text:
{{WPMILHIST|class=b | B1 = y | B2 = y | B3 = y | B4 = y | B5 = y |British-task-force=yes}} ==Status: notability?== Does it make sense to limit new additions to this list? Is it appropriate at this stage of the article's development to initiate a standard limiting names on this select list to :(a) those who already have Wikipedia articles :and :(b) those who are notable for something other than having depicted war in art -- ''see,'' e.g., US [[Navy Cross (United States)|Navy Cross]] edit history? In a context informed by practices which seem to have worked out well at [[Navy Cross (United States)|Navy Cross]], all new additions who aren't already featured in an article could be re-redirected to this talk page section with the following edit history explanation: :: redlink/artist name ''must be known for something other than depicting war -- see "Status: Notability" on talk page'' The redlinks of those whose names were added, but who do not have an article yet are listed below: ;Notable British war artists
* [[Stephen Bone]], [[Second World War]] * [[Paul Bullard]], 1918-1996, Second World War.[[Canadian War Museum]] (CWM), [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/paul-bullard_e.shtml Paul Bullard] * [[Graham Barry Clilverd]], Second World War * [[Leslie Cole]], 1910-1977, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/leslie-cole_e.shtml Leslie Cole] * [[Richard Eurich|Richard Ernst Eurich]], 1903 â€“ 1992, Second World War * [[Anthony Gross]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]] [[Royal Academy|RA]], 1905-1984, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/anthony-gross_e.shtml Anthony Gross] * [[Archibald Hartrick|Archibald Standish Hartrick]] (1864-1950), [[First World War]] * [[Elsie Hewland]], 1935 -    , Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/elsie-hewland_e.shtml Elsie Hewland] * [[Cedric Kennedy]], 1898-1968, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/cedric-kennedy_e.shtml Cedric Kennedy] * [[Linda Kitson]], Falklands campaign * [[Edwin La Dell]] [[Associate of the Royal Academy|RA]], 1914-1970, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/edwin-la-dell_e.shtml Edwin La Dell] * [[James Morris (artist)|James Morris]], Second World War * [[Rodrigo Moynihan]] [[Royal Academy|RA]] [[Order of the British Empire|CBE]], 1910-1990, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/rodrigo-moynihan_e.shtml Rodrigo Moynihan] * [[Charles Pears]], 1873 - 1958, First World War * [[George Plante]], 1914-1995, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/george-plante_e.shtml George Plante] * [[Leonard Rosoman]] [[Royal Academy|RA]], 1935 -    , Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/leonard-rosoman_e.shtml Leonard Rosoman] * [[Alfred Thomson]] [[Royal Academy|RA]], 1894-1979, Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/alfred-thomson_e.shtml A. R. Thomson] * [[Matvyn Wright]], 1910 -    , Second World War.CWM, [http://www.civilization.ca/cwm/exhibitions/artwar/artists/matvyn-wright_e.shtml Matvyn Wright] ;Notes {{reflist}} When any of the above-listed redlink names turn blue, we will know that transferring these names to the talk page was a worthwhile exercise. If none turn blue, then we will have learned that this was a waste of time and effort. --[[User:Tenmei|Tenmei]] ([[User talk:Tenmei|talk]]) 00:47, 27 July 2010 (UTC)
